intro: Pterichis yungasensis, commonly known as the Yungas pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the humid cloud forests of Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in understory layers of the forest. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Pterichis yungasensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
